billsco

Dan Rather and CBS News have really lost. Big time. To put it in a Ratherism, "When the boys were comin' home from the hayfield, Dan was still puttin' on his work boots." 
 
 The ratings were so distant--and so dismal--it requires some analysis to try to understand why. Allow me to give it a shot.
 
 Big Three network news organizations understand that viewers wish to be entertained. They can talk all they want about the seriousness of their jobs in reporting events, but if feel-good segments aren't a large part of the evening news, then don't expect ratings. 
 
 CBS has been the most stodgy of the three networks, more conservative, always attracting older viewers. Rather has been a poor fit, IMO, unabashedly liberal, and he has had his share of odd stories in which he became the focus, such as the Democratic Convention, the Nixon show-down, the cab ride, the "Gunga-Dan" stories, "Courage" sign-off, sweaters and lately, the National Guard fiasco. It almost seems now like they were all staged, the "hey, look at me" deal.
 
 NBC airs more human interest stories (better known as fluff) and became the nightly news leader, period. In 2002, Rather tried to emulate that success by attempting more hip broadcasts and flashier graphics. It failed, simply because no one wanted to watch an old man be someone he wasn't. 
 
 And that's the way it is.
Haulingboat
